repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photocopies of the Constitution and By-Laws of the Protective Association of Professional Baseball Players, 1890-1914.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Baseball Players Association Early Documents #5132m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Major League Baseball Players Association (or MLBPA) is the collective bargaining representative for all current Major League Baseball players. All players, managers, coaches, and athletic trainers who hold or have held a signed contract with a Major League club are eligible for membership in the Association. The MLBPA has three major divisions: a labor union, a business (Players Choice Group Licensing Program), and a charitable foundation (Major League Baseball Players Trust). The MLBPA primarily serves as a collective bargaining representative for all Major League Baseball players, as well as playing significant roles in MLB-related business and non-profit affairs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6355 AV: Charles Korr's Major League Baseball Interview Audio Tapes
